message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a great deal on this amazing product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $14000.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Can you meet me at this price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob! However, I'm not sure I can meet you at $12000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $13500. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $11500. Can you consider this price?

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm not comfortable going that low. I can offer you a slight discount, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to sell it to you for $13000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to offer a discount, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $11000 for the product. Can you consider this price?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we might not meet in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to make one more significant concession. I can offer it to you for $12500. This is as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $11200 for the product. Can you consider this price?

I'm not willing to go any lower, Bob. I've already made significant concessions, and I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $11500, but that's as low as I'll go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand that you've made significant concessions, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $11000 for the product. This is my final offer. Can you consider this price?
